## Q1 — Getting an element of a vector by index {#q1}

What is the element at index 200 of `my_vec`?

```{webr}
#| echo: false
set.seed(1)
my_vec <- rnorm(1000, mean = 100, sd = 10)
```

```{webr}
my_vec[200]
# 96.18924
```

## Q2 — Find the average {#q2}

Compute the mean of c(1,7,9,16,32).

```{webr}
mean(c(1,7,9,16,32))
# 13
```

## Q3 — Draw a histogram {#q3}

Draw a histogram of the Height column from height_weight.csv to answer the following question.

Based on the histogram, which statement best describes the distribution of heights?
```{webr}
hw = read.csv("height_weight.csv")
hist(hw$height)
# Approximately symmetric and unimodal
```

## Q4 — Draw a boxplot {#q4}

Draw a boxplot of the Height column from height_weight.csv to answer the following question.

What is the median height in the dataset?
```{webr}
boxplot(hw$height)
# 68
```

## Q5 — Outliers Existence {#q5}

Draw a boxplot of the Height column from height_weight.csv to answer the following question.

Does the boxplot suggest the presence of any outliers?
```{webr}
boxplot(hw$height)
# Outliers on the right only
```

## Q6 — Count rows {#q6}
How many rows are in visits.csv?
```{webr}
df_visits = read.csv("visits.csv")
nrow(df_visits)
# 20
```

## Q7 — Count Columns {#q7}
How many columns are in visits.csv?
```{webr}
ncol(df_visits)
# 2
```

## Q8 — Mean visits {#q8}
What is the mean of the Visits column in visits.csv?
```{webr}
mean(df_visits)
# 40.9
```

## Q9 — Sample variance {#q9}
What is the sample variance of the Visits column in visits.csv?
```{webr}
var(df_visits)
# 58.62105
```

## Q10 — Maximum visits {#q10}
What is the maximum number of visits in a single day in visits.csv?
```{webr}
max(df_visits)
# 53
```
